Configuring
Configuring / Configuring document processing features / Using RICOH ProcessDirector Plug-in for Adobe Acrobat / Working with document properties
/ Saving document property values
Saving document property values
After you create document properties in a sample PDF file, you can save the data values for those properties. For example, you can save the
account numbers in a PDF file that you plan on printing for an audit or printed in the past for an audit.
To save document property values:
1. While viewing document property values, click Save.
2. Select a location for the file and type a name, or use the name and location of the PDF file with a .txt extension.
3. Click Save.
RICOH ProcessDirector Plug-in for Adobe Acrobat generates a tab-delimited text file containing the values.
Parent topic: Working with document properties
